Package game

Class JosephusCircle

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.JosephusCircle
  • public class JosephusCircle
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to represent a Josephus Circle.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      JosephusCircle​(int playerCount)
      Creates a new JosephusCircle object with the maximum players given.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addPlayer​(java.lang.String player)
      Adds a new player to the game from left-to-right in the internal linked list.
      java.lang.String getCircle()
      Returns a string representing the internal state of the circle, with the following format: "<-- Player A <--> Player B <--> Player C <--> Player D -->"
      boolean isGameOver()
      Returns true if the game is over.
      java.lang.String moveCursor​(Direction direction, int steps)
      Moves the current player (the cursor) from the current position the given number of steps to the left or right
      void removeAtCursor​(Direction direction)
      Removes the player at the cursor position from the circle.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • JosephusCircle

        public JosephusCircle​(int playerCount)
        Creates a new JosephusCircle object with the maximum players given.
        Parameters:
        playerCount - the maximum number of players that can play in this circle

    • Method Detail

      • addPlayer

        public void addPlayer​(java.lang.String player)
        Adds a new player to the game from left-to-right in the internal linked list.
        Parameters:
        player - the new player name

      • moveCursor

        public java.lang.String moveCursor​(Direction direction,
                                   int steps)
        Moves the current player (the cursor) from the current position the given number of steps to the left or right
        Parameters:
        direction - which direction to move the cursor
        steps - how many steps to move the cursor
        Returns:
        the player the cursor ends up on after moving

      • removeAtCursor

        public void removeAtCursor​(Direction direction)
        Removes the player at the cursor position from the circle.
        Parameters:
        direction - moves the cursor one position to the left or right depending on the direction

      • getCircle

        public java.lang.String getCircle()
        Returns a string representing the internal state of the circle, with the following format: "<-- Player A <--> Player B <--> Player C <--> Player D -->"
        Returns:
        a string representation of the circle of players

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        Returns true if the game is over. That is, this method will return true if only one player remains in the circle.
        Returns:
        true if game over, otherwise false
